ovdesc.p: Where an anaylsis of an outstanding item is carried out, a certain type is assigned to that item as specified on the MI.STAT.DEFINITION file using the MI.SELECTION mechanism.
Records on this file are used to assign a cost and the profit centres to be debited / credited with this cost to the statistical type defined on the MI.STAT.DEFINITION record.

desc.p: This field indicates whether the cost should be equally shared among customers when multiple customers are specified in a transaction.
For eg if a cost of 10$ is allocated to a transaction and a transaction between 3 customers A,B,C is processed in the system. If this field holds a value
a. YES it indicates that a cost of 3.33$ will be allocated to A, B and C.
b. NO will indicate each customer will be allocated a cost of 10$.
The transaction code used for the crediting entry is defined in this field and will be used as the contents of the TRANS.CODE.CR field on any MI.STAT records created with this MI.STAT.TYPE.
Must be the key to a valid record on the TRANSACTION file.
The profit centre which will incur the charge for this type of outstanding record is defined in this field, and is used as the contents for the PROFIT.CNTR.CR field on the resulting MI.STAT record.
The DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER may be defined in one of two ways ;
1) As a constant. Here the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER code is specified within a pair of double quotes, e.g. "1000" reference DEPT.ACCT.OFFCIER 1000.

2) As a mapping field. Here a field name is defined. At the time that the associated process is run, this field name is evaluated from the record being processed and the result is set on the MI.STAT record.
Either the key to a valid DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER record enclosed in double quotes, OR a field name. In the latter case no validation is provided.
The weighting to be applied to the MI.UNIT.COST.
Up to 8 numeric characters, and a further two decimal places.
The transaction code used for the debiting entry is defined in this field and will be used as the contents of the TRANS.CODE.DR field on any MI.STAT records created with this MI.STAT.TYPE.
Must be the key to a valid record on the TRANSACTION file.
The profit and loss category to be used is defined in this field and will be used as the contents of the PL.CATEGORY field on any MI.STAT records created with this MI.STAT.TYPE.
Must be the key to a valid record on the CATEGORY file.
Input must be within the profit and loss range, 50000 to 69999.
The profit centre which will receive the charge for this type of outstanding record is defined in this field, and is used as the contents for the PROFIT.CNTR.DR field on the resulting MI.STAT record.
The DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER may be defined in one of two ways ;
1) As a constant. Here the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER code is specified within a pair of double quotes, e.g. "1000" reference DEPT.ACCT.OFFCIER 1000.

2) As a mapping field. Here a field name is defined. At the time that the associated process is run, this field name is evaluated from the record being processed and the result is set on the MI.STAT record.
Either the key to a valid DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER record enclosed in double quotes, OR a field name. In the latter case no validation is provided.
The description of the record is held in this field.
The key to the MI.STAT.TYPE record is defined here.
The MI.UNIT.COST to be assigned to the MI.STAT.TYPE.
Must be the key to a valid MI.UNIT.COST record.
